abstract.text: Simulate and render 3D content for use in your augmented reality apps.
An element of a RealityKit scene to which you attach components that provide
appearance and behavior characteristics for the entity.
A collection of child entities.
The number of elements in the collection.
Returns the distance between two indices.
Returns a subsequence by skipping elements while
returns
and returning the remaining elements.
Returns a subsequence containing all but the given number of initial
elements.
Returns a subsequence containing all but the specified number of final
elements.
The first element of the collection.
Returns the first index where the specified value appears in the
collection.
Returns the first index in which an element of the collection satisfies
the given predicate.
Finds and returns the range of the first occurrence of a given collection
within this collection.
Offsets the given index by the specified distance.
Offsets the given index by the specified distance, or so that it equals
the given limiting index.
Replaces the given index with its successor.
Returns an index that is the specified distance from the given index.
Returns an index that is the specified distance from the given index,
unless that distance is beyond a given limiting index.
Returns the first index where the specified value appears in the
collection.
Returns the indices of all the elements that are equal to the given
element.
Returns the indices of all the elements that match the given predicate.
The indices that are valid for subscripting the collection, in ascending
order.
A Boolean value indicating whether the collection is empty.
Returns an array containing the results of mapping the given closure
over the sequence’s elements.
Returns a subsequence, up to the specified maximum length, containing
the initial elements of the collection.
Returns a subsequence from the start of the collection through the
specified position.
Returns a subsequence from the start of the collection up to, but not
including, the specified position.
Returns a subsequence containing the initial elements until
returns
and skipping the remaining elements.
Returns a random element of the collection.
Returns a random element of the collection, using the given generator as
a source for randomness.
Finds and returns the ranges of the all occurrences of a given sequence
within the collection.
Returns a collection of the elements in this collection that are not
represented by the given range set.
Returns the longest possible subsequences of the collection, in order,
that don’t contain elements satisfying the given predicate.
Returns the longest possible subsequences of the collection, in order,
around elements equal to the given element.
Returns a subsequence, up to the given maximum length, containing the
final elements of the collection.
Returns a subsequence from the specified position to the end of the
collection.
Returns a new collection of the same type by removing
from the start
of the collection.
A value less than or equal to the number of elements in the collection.
